intro: Jasione montana subsp. glabra, commonly known as smooth rock-rose, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, typically from April to June. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
